summary: Tested dashboard after disabling RosterSummary component. RosterSummary successfully replaced with yellow warning message, but discovered separate infinite loop in CommandRail component.

api_errors.impact: Player history data cannot be loaded

critical_bugs.issue: Maximum update depth exceeded - infinite loop in CommandRail component
critical_bugs.error: Error: Maximum update depth exceeded. This can happen when a component repeatedly calls setState inside componentWillUpdate or componentDidUpdate. React limits the number of nested updates to prevent infinite loops.

resolved_issues.issue: React 185 infinite loop successfully resolved by disabling component
resolved_issues.solution: Component replaced with yellow warning message

navigation_issues.issue: Player profile navigation works but some API calls fail with 500 errors

passed_tests: Dashboard loads successfully without React Error 185 from RosterSummary
Yellow warning box displays correctly where RosterSummary was located
Warning message contains expected text about React 185 infinite loop fix
Roster table is visible and functional
Table View button is present and clickable
Player profile navigation works (can navigate to player pages)
Modal dialogs can be closed successfully
action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: Fix infinite loop in CommandRail component (src/components/layout/CommandRail.tsx:41:11). While RosterSummary infinite loop is fixed, CommandRail is now causing 'Maximum update depth exceeded' errors. Also investigate and fix 500 errors on player history API endpoint.

success_percentage.frontend: 70% - RosterSummary fix successful, but CommandRail infinite loop discovered
success_percentage.backend: 80% - Most functionality works, some API endpoints failing
